the print of the murderers finger was
on his neck.

He was conveyed home and the
anguish that was
visible in my countenance revealed
the secret to Elizabeth. She was
very earnest to see the corpse. ^
At first I attempted to prevent her but she persisted,
and entering the room where it lay
hastily examined the neck of
the victim and clasping her
hands exclaimed— Oh God! I have
murdered my darling
infant.

She fainted and was retored with
extreme difficulty; when she again
lived it was only to weep and sigh–
She told me that that same evening
William had teazed her to let him
wear a very valuable miniature
she possessed of your Mother. This
picture is gone and was doubtless
the temptation which urged the mur
derer to the deed. We have no trace
at
present of him, altho our exertions to discover him
are unremitted; but they will not restore
my beloved William.
